intro: Matthiola oxyceratia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stock, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pale pink to white, with four petals arranged symmetrically. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
